required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Colchicine Plus Phenolic Monoterpenes to Treat COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Application of Colchicine Plus Herbal Phenolic Monoterpene Fractions to Treat COVID-19

brief_summary.textblock: In this randomized controlled clinical trial, defined cases of COVID-19 with mild, moderate, or severe pneumonia (according to the NIH guideline) were treated with conventional treatment regimens (controls) as well as in combination with oral administration of colchicine plus herbal phenolic monoterpene fractions (intervention arm). After randomization, each group received the mentioned treatments and were evaluated for different variables including mortality, hospitalization duration, intensive care unit (ICU) administration ratios as well as laboratory variables such as leukocytes and lymphocytes count. The follow-up period considered as 2 weeks after discharge. The mentioned variables were assessed as before and after receiving the treatment in each group as well as intergroup analysis for comparing both baseline and final values.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to 14 days after being discharge.
primary_outcome.description: All cause of death in duration hospitalization

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Admission to discharge dates (approximately 4-14 days after admission). Discharge variables considered as the last available data before their death for the expired patients.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in patients' oxygen saturation levels assessed by non-invasive method (pulse oximetry)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of hospitalization for the patients (admission to discharge dates, approximately 4-14 days after admission). The patients who died were excluded.
secondary_outcome.description: Day(s) each patient has spent in the hospital as an inpatient.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Admission to discharge dates (approximately 4-14 days after admission). Discharge variables considered as the last available data before their death for the expired patients.
Admission to discharge dates (approximately 4-14 days after admission). Discharge variables considered as the last available data before their death for the expired patients.

arm_group.description: Patients diagnosed with COVID-19 which receive the standard treatment national guideline

arm_group.arm_group_label: Colchicine and Herbal Phenolic Monoterpene Fractions
arm_group.description: Patients diagnosed with COVID-19 which receive the standard treatment national guideline plus Colchicine and Herbal Phenolic Monoterpene Fractions

intervention.description: Standard Treatment for COVID-19 based on National Recommendations

intervention.intervention_name: Oral administration of Colchicine plus Herbal Phenolic Monoterpene Fractions
intervention.description: Colchicine plus a Herbal extraction containing a Phenolic Monoterpene Fractions will be added to standard treatment in patients with COVID-19.
intervention.arm_group_label: Colchicine and Herbal Phenolic Monoterpene Fractions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Defined cases of COVID-19 based on laboratory and/or radiological and clinical manifestation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <10, Pregnancy, Sever kidney dysfunction, Previous history of allergy to Colchicine, not willing to sign informed consent form

overall_official.affiliation: Medical Biology Research Center, Kermanshah University of Medical Sciences, Kermanshah, Iran.

facility.name: Medical Biology Research Center, Kermanshah University of Medical Sciences, Kermanshah, Iran

RETRACTED: Synergistic effects of thymoquinone and curcumin on immune response and anti-viral activity against avian influenza virus (H9N2) in turkeys. measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: Severe to critically ill COVID-19
measure.description: Moderate Illness: Individuals who show evidence of lower respiratory disease during clinical assessment or imaging and who have saturation of oxygen (SpO2) ≥94%. Severe Illness: Individuals who have SpO2 <94%, respiratory frequency >30 breaths/min, or lung infiltrates >50%. Critical Illness: Individuals who have respiratory failure, septic shock, and/or multiple organ dysfunction. The definition of severe to critically ill COVID-19 patient is according to the National Health Institute (NIH).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
